intro: Elatine hydropiper var. emersa, commonly known as water pepper, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Elatine. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and tiny, greenish flowers that appear in clusters. The plant typically grows in wet, marshy areas and is often found in temperate regions. It has a short life cycle and is known for its ability to thrive in moist environments. Its scientific name reflects its historical use in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
